definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure

sentences.english: The systolic pressure in the exercise training group was similar to that in the control group during experimental process.
sentences.chinese: 实验过程中运动训练组收缩压与对照组相近。

sentences.english: Conclusion YXQN can reduce the systolic blood pressure of SHR.
sentences.chinese: 结论养血清脑颗粒有降低SHR收缩压的作用。

sentences.english: Systole presses heighten , diastolic pressure drops , pressing of arteries and veins also increases accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 收缩压增高，舒张压下降，脉压也相应增大。

sentences.english: And, the elevation of the systolic blood pressure for the regulators was higher than those for the non-regulators.
sentences.chinese: 而且，进行情绪调节者较非调节者的收缩压提高较多。

sentences.english: This is known as the systolic pressure.
When you hear two consecutive beats, record this pressure reading as the systolic pressure.
sentences.chinese: 当你听到连续两声搏动声，记录此读数为收缩压。

pinyin: bai2 da4 yi1 gao1 xue4 ya1

definition: atrial fibrillation (abbr. for 心房顫動|心房颤动[xin1 fang2 chan4 dong4])
